Erick Thohir Bakal Temani Sri Mulyani ke Dubai Bahas Impor Migas
05 Nov 2019, 06:15 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Muhammad Ridho

Jakarta - Menteri Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) Erick Thohir mengungkapkan bahwa ia akan mendampingi Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati ke Dubai hari ini. "Hari ini saya akan mendampingi Ibu Menteri Keuangan ke Dubai," ungkap Erick usai menghadiri rapat koordinasi di kantor Kemenko Perekonomian, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Kepergiannya ke Dubai dengan Sri Mulyani yakni dalam rangka mengatur kerja sama pemerintah Indonesia dengan pemerintah Dubai untuk mengurangi impor migas."Salah satunya nanti bicara kerja sama dua pemerintah dari segi bagaimana menekan (mengurangi) impor migas," terang Erick.Namun, Erick tidak menjelaskan secara rinci bagaimana skema kerja samanya dengan pemerintah Dubai nanti.Sebagai informasi, Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat terdapat selisih defisit US$ 2,76 miliar pada realisasi neraca perdagangan migas di April 2019. Hal itu terjadi karena nilai impornya lebih besar daripada ekspor.Berdasarkan data BPS yang dikutip detikcom, Jakarta, Jumat (17/5/2019). Defisit neraca dagang migas sebesar US$ 2,76 tercatat sepanjang Januari-April 2019. Di mana ekspor migasnya sebesar US$ 4,22 miliar dan impornya US$ 6,99 miliar.Angka defisit neraca migas itu lebih rendah dibandingkan dengan periode yang sama tahun 2018. Di mana, defisitnya sebesar US$ 3,89 miliar yang dikarenakan nilai ekspornya US$ 5,16 miliar dan impornya US$ 9,06 miliar. Erick Thohir will accompany Sri Mulyani to Dubai to discuss oil and gas imports
05 Nov 2019, 06:15 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Muhammad Ridho

Jakarta - Minister of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) Erick Thohir revealed that he would accompany Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati to Dubai today. "Today I will accompany the Minister of Finance to Dubai," said Erick after attending a coordination meeting at the Coordinating Ministry for the Economy, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019). His departure to Dubai with Sri Mulyani was in order to regulate the cooperation of the Indonesian government with the Dubai government to reduce oil and gas imports. "One of them will talk about cooperation between the two governments in terms of how to reduce (reduce) oil and gas imports," explained Erick. However, Erick did not explain in detail how the cooperation scheme with the Dubai government later. As information, the Agency The Statistics Center (BPS) noted that there was a difference of a deficit of US $ 2.76 billion in the realization of the oil and gas trade balance balance in April 2019. This happened because the value of imports was greater than exports. Based on BPS data quoted detikcom, Jakarta, Friday (17/5 / 2019). The oil and gas trade balance deficit of US $ 2.76 was recorded during January-April 2019. Where oil and gas exports were US $ 4.22 billion and imports were US $ 6.99 billion. The oil and gas balance deficit was lower than the same period of the year 2018. Where, the deficit was US $ 3.89 billion due to the export value of US $ 5.16 billion and imports of US $ 9.06 billion.
